result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring

Defendant Matthew M Madisen in court.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
Deft is not eligible for SPD representation.
Deft would like time to get an atty.
Court appointed atty rights explained to the deft.
BTC: Matter adjourned, Attorney information given to defendant.  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew M Madisen
Current: 1213 Augusta St., Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 04-21-2016)
Prior: 2064 N Main St, Racine, WI 53402
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with 2064 Main Street or the residents there (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the victims, E.M and T.M. (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Matthew M Madisen in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Matthew M Madisen in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley.
VACATE WARRANT.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Warrant forwarded to RPD for entry.
